Visit https://host-ip:9443 to access the web interface.
Deafault username: admin
Default password: changeme

Visit https://{host-ip}:9443 to access the web interface.
  • Default username: admin
  • Default password: changeme

templates.title: Portainer

templates.description: This app deploys a LoRaWAN gateway with Basics™ Station Packet Forward protocol using Docker.
templates.post_up_info: Please check the Github repository https://github.com/xoseperez/basicstation for more information.
templates.note: Check LoRa Basics™ Station for Docker Github repository for more details.
templates.name: BasicsStation
templates.title: LoRa Basics™ Station for Docker

env.label: MODEL
env.name: MODEL
env.description: The model is defined depending on either the version of the Semtech chip model: SX1301, SX1302 and SX1303, or concentrator modules, or RAK WisGate Development gateway model. Check Define your MODEL section on https://github.com/xoseperez/basicstation for more details.

env.label: Device
env.name: DEVICE
env.description: Where the concentrator is connected to

env.name: INTERFACE
env.label: Concentrator interface
env.description: The interface used by the concentrator, can be guessed from Device

env.label: Gateway RESET GPIO
env.name: GW_RESET_GPIO
env.description: GPIO number that resets (Broadcom pin number)

env.label: Gateway ENABLE GPIO
env.name: GW_ENABLE_GPIO
env.description: GPIO number that enables power (by pulling HIGH) to the concentrator (Broadcom pin number)

env.label: GATEWAY EUI NIC
env.name: GATEWAY_EUI_NIC
env.description: Interface to use when generating the EUI

env.label: GATEWAY EUI
env.name: GATEWAYEUI
env.description: Gateway EUI to use, autogenerated from GATEWAY EUI NIC if defined, otherwise in order from: eth0, wlan0, usb0

env.label: TTN REGION
env.name: TTN_REGION
env.description: Region of the TTN server to use, possible values: eu1, nam1, au1

env.default: change this to your own TC key from TTN
env.label: TC KEY
env.name: TC_KEY
env.description: Unique TTN Gateway Key used for TTS Community Edition pasted from TTN console

templates.description: This app dockerize the rak_common_for_gateway project, which aim to help users to use the RAK Raspberry Pi Developer Gateway more easily.
templates.post_up_info: Please check the Github repository https://github.com/RAKWireless/udp-packet-forwarder for more information.
templates.note: Check LoRaWAN UDP Packet Forwarder Protocol for Docker Github repository for more details.
templates.name: UDPPacketForwarder
templates.title: UDP Packet Forwarder

env.name: MODEL
env.label: RAK gateway model/RAK WisLink LPWAN module
env.description: RAKwireless Developer gateway model or RAKwireless WisLink LPWAN module. Once defined, we take care of all the concentrator configurations and you can skip to option <Interface for gateway EUI>

env.name: CONCENTRATOR
env.label: Semtech concentrator
env.description: If RAK gateway model is not defined, you can define <Semtech concentrator> instead. Once defined this env variable, also need to specify other features of the module, for example, <Concentrator interface>,<HAS GPS>,<HAS LTE>.

env.name: INTERFACE
env.label: Concentrator interface
env.description: If MODEL is defined it will get the interface type from it, otherwise defaults to SPI

env.name: HAS_GPS
env.label: Has GPS
env.description: If MODEL is defined it will get this from it, otherwise defaults to 1 (with GPS)

env.name: HAS_LTE
env.label: Has LTE
env.description: If MODEL id defined it will get this from it, otherwise defaults to 0 (without LTE)

env.name: RESET_GPIO
env.label: GATEWAY RESET GPIO
env.description: GPIO number that resets (Broadcom pin number)

env.name: POWER_EN_GPIO
env.label: the GPIO enables power
env.description: GPIO number that enables power (by pulling HIGH) to the concentrator (Broadcom pin number). 0 means not required

env.name: RADIO_DEV
env.label: Where the concentrator is connected to
env.description: Don't set it if you don't know what this means, /dev/spidev0.0 for SPI concentrators, /dev/ttyACM0 for USB concentrators.

env.name: GPS_DEV
env.label: Where the GPS is connected to
env.description: Don't set it if you don't know what this means, /dev/ttyAMA0 except when HAS_LTE is 1, in this case it will default to /dev/i2c-1.

env.name: GATEWAY_EUI_NIC
env.label: Interface for gateway EUI
env.description: Interface to use when generating the EUI, default to eth0

env.name: GATEWAY_EUI
env.label: Gateway EUI
env.description: Autogenerated from GATEWAY_EUI_NIC if defined, otherwise in order from: eth0, wlan0, usb0

env.name: TTN_REGION
env.label: TTN region
env.description: If using a TTN server, region of the TTN server to use. Can be eu1, nam1, and au1

env.name: SERVER_HOST
env.label: Host Server URL
env.description: If TTN_REGION is defined it will build the right address for the TTN server

env.name: SERVER_PORT
env.label: Server port
env.description: Port the server is listening to

env.name: BAND
env.label: TTN Frequency Plan
env.description: Regional parameters identifier

env.name: GPS_LATITUDE
env.label: GPS LATITUDE
env.description: Report this latitude for the gateway

env.name: GPS_LONGITUDE
env.label: GPS LONGITUDE
env.description: Report this longitude for the gateway

env.name: GPS_ALTITUDE
env.label: GPS ALTITUDE
env.description: Report this altitude for the gateway

env.name: SERVER_PORT

templates.description: The Helium gateway-rs is a service designed to run on Linux-based LoRaWAN gateways. It's intended to run alongside a typical LoRa packet forwarder and to connect via Semtech's Gateway Messaging Protocol. It does not mine HNT for now but can be used to increase coverage on the Helium network.
templates.post_up_info:
The image comes with helium/gateway-rs & helium-wallet packages installed.
Start a UDP packet forwarder service first, make sure to set the packet forwarder to forward to the (default) configured helium-gateway on 127.0.0.1 at udp port 1680.
The gateway_key.bin file is stored under /etc/helium_gateway on your host by default.
To get the public key address and animal name on your host, please use this command: docker exec {container name} helium_gateway key info.
Please check https://github.com/helium/gateway-rs for more details.
templates.note:
The image comes with helium/gateway-rs & helium-wallet packages.
Start a UDP packet forwarder service first, make sure to set the packet forwarder to forward to the (default) configured helium-gateway on 127.0.0.1 at udp port 1680.
The gateway_key.bin file is stored under /etc/helium_gateway on your host by default.
Use the command docker exec {container name} helium_gateway key info on your host to get the public key address and animal name.
Check Helium gateway-rs Github Repository for more details.
templates.name: HeliumGatewayRS
templates.title: Helium gateway-rs

env.name: version
env.label: Version of gateway-rs package
env.description: Version of gateway-rs package, default is set to the latest. You can specify a history version, for example, v1.0.0-alpha.29. Please check the release note at https://github.com/helium/gateway-rs/releases

env.name: platform
env.label: Supported Platforms
env.description: Check the Supported Platform section on https://github.com/helium/gateway-rs to see if your platfrom is on the list

env.name: region
env.label: Region
env.description: Possible valuess for regional parameters

templates.description: Zigbee2MQTT is a nodejs Gateway application that connects Zigbee networks to MQTT networks.
templates.post_up_info:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:<8002> to access the web interface, or change the external port number to your customised port number. 
Check https://www.zigbee2mqtt.io/guide/configuration/ for Zigbee2MQTT configuration guide.
templates.note: Browse to http://{host-ip}:8002 to access the web interface, or change the external port number to your customised port number. Check Zigbee2MQTT configuration guide for more details.

env.label: MQTT base topic
env.name: ZIGBEE2MQTT_CONFIG_MQTT_BASE_TOPIC
env.description: Default MQTT base topic

env.label: MQTT server address
env.name: ZIGBEE2MQTT_CONFIG_MQTT_SERVER
env.description: MQTT server address

env.label: Zigbee Adapter path
env.name: ZIGBEE2MQTT_CONFIG_SERIAL_PORT
env.description: Zigbee Adapter path, for example, the serial port the adapter connected to:

env.label: Frontend external port
env.name: external_port
env.description: Frontend external port bind to Zigbee2MQTT service's 8080 port. Browse to http://{host-ip}:<Frontend external port> to access the web interface.

templates.title: Zigbee2MQTT

templates.description: Seafile is an open source file sync&share solution designed for high reliability, performance and productivity.
templates.post_up_info:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:80 to access the web interface. HTTPS is not enabled by default.
After login, please go to System admin on top right, then navigate to Settings, and change the FILE_SERVER_ROOT URL to http://{host-ip}/seafhttp.
Check https://manual.seafile.com/docker/deploy_seafile_with_docker/ for Seafile Community Installation Guide.
templates.note:
Browse to http://{host-ip}:80 to access the web interface. HTTPS is not enabled by default.
After login, please go to System admin on top right, then navigate to Settings, and change the FILE_SERVER_ROOT URL to http://{host-ip}/seafhttp.
Check Seafile Community Installation Guide for more details.

env.label: MySQL service's root password for the service called db
env.name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.description: Required, must be the same with password for service named seafile

env.label: MySQL service's root password for the service named seafile
env.name: DB_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.description: Required, must be the same with password for the service called db

env.label: Seafile admin user email
env.name: SEAFILE_ADMIN_EMAIL
env.description: Specifies Seafile admin user, default is 'me@example.com'.

env.label: Seafile admin user password
env.name: SEAFILE_ADMIN_PASSWORD
env.description: Seafile admin password, default is 'changeme'

env.label: Whether to use https or not
env.name: SEAFILE_SERVER_LETSENCRYPT
env.description: Whether to use https or not. If https is enabled, please publish port 443 manually

env.label: Seafile Server_HOSTNAME
env.name: SEAFILE_SERVER_HOSTNAME
env.description: Specifies your host name if https is enabled.

templates.title: Seafile

templates.description: Tailscale is a zero config VPN. It can be Installed on any device in minutes, it manages firewall rules for users, and works from anywhere.
templates.post_up_info:
Create an account at https://tailscale.com/ first, and then check https://tailscale.com/kb/1085/auth-keys/ for Tailscale's official documentation on how to generate an authkey.
Copy the key and fill in to the TS_AUTH_KEY variable provided, and then deploy the service
templates.note:
Create an account at Tailscale first, and then check Tailscale's official documentation on how to generate an authkey.
Copy the key and fill in to the TS_AUTH_KEY variable below, and then deploy the service

env.label: TS_AUTH_KEY
env.name: TS_AUTH_KEY
env.description: Pre-authentication keys (“auth keys” for short) let you register new nodes without needing to sign in via a web browser, check https://tailscale.com/kb/1085/auth-keys/ for more details.

templates.title: Tailscale
templates.name: Tailscale

templates.description: InfluxDB is a time series database built from the ground up to handle high write and query loads.
templates.post_up_info: Check https://hub.docker.com/_/influxdb for InfluxDB Dockerhub quick reference.
templates.note: Check InfluxDB Dockerhub quick reference for more details.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE
env.label: Influx initial mode
env.description: Set DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_MODE to setup enables the InfluxDB image to automatically bootstrap the system.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_USERNAME
env.label: Influx initial username
env.description: The username to set for the system's initial super-user (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_PASSWORD
env.label: Influx initial password
env.description: The password to set for the system's inital super-user (Required,at least 8 characters).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ORG
env.label: Influx initial organization
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial organization (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_BUCKET
env.label: Influx initial bucket
env.description: The name to set for the system's initial bucket (Required).

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_RETENTION
env.label: Influx initial bucket retain data duration
env.description: Optional. E.g. 1w means tetain te data for 1 week. If not set, the initial bucket will retain data forever.

env.name: DOCKER_INFLUXDB_INIT_ADMIN_TOKEN
env.label: initial super-user's authentication token to associate with the system's
env.description: Optional. The authentication token to associate with the system's initial super-user. If not set, a token will be auto-generated by the system.

templates.name: InfluxDB
templates.title: InfluxDB

templates.description: Telegraf is an agent for collecting metrics and writing them to InfluxDB or other outputs.
templates.post_up_info: The default configuration requires a running InfluxDB instance as an output plugin. Ensure that InfluxDB is running on port 8086 before starting the Telegraf container. Browse to https://hub.docker.com/_/telegraf for Telegraf dockerhub quick reference.
templates.note:
The default configuration requires a running InfluxDB instance as an output plugin.

templates.description: Docker Registry is a stateless, highly scalable server side application that stores and lets you distribute Docker images.
templates.post_up_info:
Quick reference:
1. Pull(or build some image from the hub, e.g., ubuntu)
docker pull ubuntu
2. Tag the image so that it points to your registry
docker image tag ubuntu localhost:5000/myfirstimage
3. Push it
docker push localhost:5000/myfirstimage
4. Pull it back
 docker pull localhost:5000/myfirstimage
templates.note:
Check Docker Registry dockerhub overview page for more details.
Read the section regarding deployment to see more complex use cases.
templates.name: Registry
templates.title: Registry

templates.description: Azure SQL Edge is an optimized relational database engine geared for IoT and IoT Edge deployments. It provides capabilities to create a high-performance data storage and processing layer for IoT applications and solutions.
templates.post_up_info:
Quick reference:
Please check https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql-edge/disconnected-deployment for detailed instructions.
Make sure you changed the SA password afte deployment.
templates.note:
Check the instructions Deploy Azure SQL Edge with Docker for more details.
Make sure you changed the SA password afte deployment.

env.label: Accept the End-User Licensing Agreement
env.name: ACCEPT_EULA
env.description: Set the ACCEPT_EULA variable to any value to confirm your acceptance of the End-User Licensing Agreement. Required setting for the Azure SQL Edge image.

env.label: Initial strong password for SQL SA account.
env.name: MSSQL_SA_PASSWORD
env.description: Strong password that is at least 8 characters and meets the Azure SQL Edge password requirements, you need to change it manually after deployment.

templates.name: AzureSqlEdge
templates.title: Azure SQL Edge

templates.description: AWS IoT Greengrass is an open-source edge runtime and cloud service that helps you build, deploy, and manage intelligent device software.
templates.post_up_info:
Please mount the folder that contains your AWS security credentials by filling in the AWS credentials path section.
You can remove the credential file from the host computer after you start the AWS IoT Greengrass container.
Check https://docs.aws.amazon.com/greengrass/v2/developerguide/run-greengrass-docker-automatic-provisioning.html#configure-aws-credentials-for-docker for the AWS IoT Greengrass Developer Guide.
For more information, check the official Github repository at https://github.com/aws-greengrass/aws-greengrass-docker.
templates.note:
Please mount the folder that contains your AWS security credentials by filling in the AWS credentials path section.
You can remove the credential file from the host computer after you start the AWS IoT Greengrass container.
Check AWS IoT Greengrass Developer Guide.
For more information, check official Github repository.
templates.name: AWSIoTGreengrass
templates.title: AWS IoTG Greengrass

env.label: AWS credentials path
env.name: AWS_CREDENTIALS_PATH
env.description: Geerated at your AWS console. When you run the Docker image, you must mount the folder that contains this credential file to /root/.aws/ in the Docker container.

env.label: GGC_ROOT_PATH
env.name: GGC_ROOT_PATH
env.description: The Greengrass root folder that you want to use for installation.

env.label: AWS_REGION
env.name: AWS_REGION
env.description: The AWS Region where you created the resources.

env.label: CONFIG
env.name: CONFIG
env.description: Contains all relevant configuration files.

env.label: SOURCE

env.description: Path to source for files to backup.

env.label: BACKUPS
env.name: BACKUPS
env.description: Path to store local backups.
